se habitan.

On questions

Ludopoiesis begins with a question.

We think asking is searching for an answer.
But good questions are not answered:
they are inhabited.
They expand.
They change over time.

Answers come with questions.
But the answer that arrives may not be the one you expected.
That doesnâ€™t mean you asked the wrong question.
Maybe youâ€™re not asking enough questions.

A good question doesnâ€™t closeâ€”it opens.
It doesnâ€™t confirmâ€”it provokes.
It doesnâ€™t calmâ€”it ignites.

Itâ€™s not about asking a question and finding an answer.
Itâ€™s about asking a question that generates many more questions.
And those new questions, in turn, others.

And as you learn to ask,
you learn to see the world with curiosity,
to navigate it, to move with it.
To flow.

Itâ€™s not about finding answers.
Itâ€™s about flowing.

Now ask a question. Something that keeps you awake, curious.
